title: Moment Of Fate
opening: Of all the battles in the war so far, the contest for Fort Pinell is the fiercest to date. And from this horrific clash of weapons and wills, the Crimean army emerges bloodied and exhausted, yet victorious. The prize of Fort Pinell is no small thing, but it is the promise of additional reinforcements from Gallia-- and the large Begnion army encamped in Castle Daein--that keeps the breath of hope alive in the soldiers' hearts. There is one other pivotal piece in Daein's defense of the former Crimean capital--the severely undermanned Castle Nados. As the day's end draws near, Tibarn's small force of hawks and Gallians cease their attacks and return to camp headquarters.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Why did you return to Crimea? You had the perfect opportunity to escape.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...I'm going to the capital.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: No. You are not. The king has ordered me to put an end to you.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: I thought as much... So be it. I am prepared.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Will you not resist?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: I do not believe I could prevail against one of your power.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: How extremely frank.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: My only wish was to be beside the one I love. If that is not to be, then it matters not what happens to me.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: As my last act of compassion, I shall make your end a swift and merciful one. Do you have any final words?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...If you see Nasir, tell him that Ena was sorry.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: If I have the opportunity, I will so tell him. Rest in peace.

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...My...love...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Turn and face me, Black Knight!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Hmph. I've been waiting for you, child.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ah! Did you kill that girl?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Despite my promise, the blow was not clean. She breathes still.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I'll take her.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: You'll have to do so by force. You brought the sacred sword Ragnell, did you not?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It's right here. If using it is the only condition I need fulfill to defeat you, I will not hesitate!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: It appears you've grown smarter. Good. There is no challenge in killing a fool. Shall we begin?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Brother!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist? No! Stay back!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I... I will fight you! I'll never let you kill my brother!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist, you--

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Gawain's daughter, eh? Good. Now I can pull out the entire family tree by the root.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You're not to interfere, Mist! This craven wretch is mine!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Hmph! Do as you will. This time, we begin in earnest!

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Commander, can I speak to you for a moment?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it, Titania?

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: I have...something important to ask of you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right, what is it?

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: I want you to tell me...about the night Commander Greil was killed. I understand that it's difficult for you. However, I need to know. I have to. Just tell it once... It's all I ask. If you can't, I... His death will be something I'll never be able to face.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I feel I've done you a terrible disservice by not telling you earlier. It's just that... There was a lot I had to get clear in my own mind. I know I've kept you waiting.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: So you'll tell me?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yes. I think I've finally come to a point where I can face it.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: All right. Whenever you're ready.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That night... I've already told you everything up to where I was on my way into the forest, right? At the head of the path, Father had told me to go back to the fort--but I had a bad feeling and followed him anyway. When I entered the clearing, he and the Black Knight were already fighting. They seemed to be evenly matched at first. Then they exchanged a few more blows, and suddenly Father was sent flying. They spoke to each other for a moment, but...I was so far away, I couldn't hear what they said. Then the Black Knight threw a sword at Father's feet. I think he wanted Father to pick it up and use it.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But Father didn't touch the sword. He just readied his axe again and charged.......It was over in an instant. I...I couldn't believe my own eyes. They...they looked like they were embracing...Just... Standing there. Frozen. But, I saw the Black Knight's blade...It was protruding from Father's back, and shining in the moonlight.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Oh, Greil...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: When the knight pulled his sword out, Father sagged and fell backwards... I ran and tried to catch him, but I couldn't hold him, and we both fell to the ground. The wound Father had taken was terrible, but at that point, he was still alive.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: The Black Knight approached and said, Give it to me. I had no idea what he was talking about. I do now, though. He had been sent by King Ashnard to retrieve the medallion. Father told him he'd thrown the medallion away, but the knight didn't believe him. Then he tried to get Father to talk by threatening to kill me...and Mist. I was so angry, I leapt up and attacked him, but it was useless. I didn't give up, though. I didn't care what happened to me, and I attacked again.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Of all the stubbornness...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: If King Gallia hadn't been nearby, I probably would have died that night, too.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: After the Black Knight vanished, I simply...All I could think was that I didn't want Father to die. He... He was still alive. I thought if I could just get him back to the fort, we could save him. I clung to that...false hope...and started walking toward the light of the fort... I just kept walking...

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: ...Thank you, Ike. It must have been so hard for you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Titania...

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Commander Greil died on your back. His last moments must have been...much happier than I had imagined......Thank you... Now I can finally...move past my grief...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Titania.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Yes?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I, um... There's something else I haven't told you about.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I...met him... I met the Black Knight again.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: We fought.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: You did well to keep your life.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I'm not the same boy I was on that night. I've grown a lot. I've worked hard. Yet, even so, I wasn't able to defeat him.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: There's nothing you can do about that. Not even Commander Greil could defeat him. You're not ready to--

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's not that. It's not that my blade work wasn't good enough.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Then, what do you mean?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Titania, it's his armor. It's impervious to damage.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: What? That's not possible. Even the strongest--

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: He said his armor had been blessed by the goddess. He said only weapons that were also blessed could hurt him.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Where are we supposed to get something like that?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I have one here.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Ah! Ike! That sword... Where...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: The night after Father died, I went back to that clearing by myself. I'd hoped to...I'd hoped to find some clues that might help me hunt down the knight. The sword was still there. I brought it back with me, and I've been hiding it ever since. I wasn't thinking about using it. I believed that if I just carried the sword with me, I'd meet the Black Knight again.  And it worked.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: So this sword will work against him?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's supposed to. It was made to contest Alondite, which is the sword wielded by the Black Knight.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Do you think you have a chance?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...I'll win.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: All right. I won't stop you. Use that sword to avenge Commander Greil. But listen, Ike... You must promise me one thing.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: When you meet him, you'll exchange blows. If, at that moment, you don't feel you stand a chance...you must flee. There are times when running away is not the same as losing.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Don't you believe in me, Titania?

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Of course I do. One day, you will defeat the Black Knight. I'm sure of it. That's why I don't want you to lose your life on the first go-around. When the time comes, I promise not to interfere. And I won't let anyone else interfere, either. I want you to face him, one-on-one. And I want you to be calm and use your own best judgement. At times, withdrawing can be the key that unlocks a future victory. Don't forget that.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Understood.

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: Do not interfere! This man is my prey! I need no assistance.

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Oh! Then...uh... Hey, get that girl! Kill her before she flees!

battle.speaker: Mist
battle.line: No!! I'm not leaving you! I can protect myself. I won't run away!

battle.speaker: Black Knight
battle.line: Will you flee? How appropriate. Tuck tail and run, child of Gawain! It is what dogs do best, after all. I like how you tremble with fear at the realization that you are no match for me. It suits you.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Foul villain! I do not flee. I will never turn my back on you and run away!
